lines.text: "Fear" is a spider in your room. "Anxiety" is a spider in your room but you don't know where it is.
See, once death passes over you, you can never be completely in this world again. And life becomes nothing more than a series of breaths and heartbeats, suddenly finite.
Sometimes knowing what you can do is just as good as doing it.
Another person's fear is the best drug there is. You could smell it across a room. You can drink it like vampire's blood, walk away stronger.
You know, fear is an interesting thing. If you let it control you, you live your life in the dark. But if you learn to use it, it can be your best friend.
